result.execSummary:
All charges against William Edward Griffin in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. William Edward Griffin is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Order to Dismiss
-Atty Nguyen
Pre-trial conference on October 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.

NOT ON RECORD - JA TOOK UP. Defendant William Edward Griffin in court. Prosecuting Atty Isaac R. Lent appeared for State of Wisconsin. Currently no counsel and not looking to retain counsel. VG requests no contact be dropped, restraining order is dropped. Atty Lent not sure on Atty Nguyen's thoughts. Court modifies bond to drop restraining order. Defendant signed amended bond.

The defendant shall appear on all court dates; give written notice to the Clerk of Court  within 48 hours of any change of address or telephone number;  shall not commit any crime; shall neither directly nor indirectly threaten, harass, intimidate or otherwise interfere with victims or witnesses in this action.  Call the Outagamie County Sheriff's Dept. at (920) 832-5633 within 48 hours for fingerprints and/or photos (to be completed within 21 days).
